intro: Pterocaulon ciliosum, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant adaptations. Pterocaulon ciliosum thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is well-suited to environments with low rainfall.
